references.paper_title: ScanNet: Richly-Annotated 3D Reconstructions of Indoor Scenes
references.reason: This paper introduced ScanNet, a widely used and influential benchmark dataset for indoor 3D scene understanding.  Its comprehensive annotations and large scale make it a crucial resource for evaluating and comparing 3D semantic segmentation models.  The paper's impact is evident in its frequent citation across various 3D vision research papers, including the current work.

references.paper_title: ScanNet: Richly-Annotated 3D Reconstructions of Indoor Scenes
references.reason: This paper introduced ScanNet, a widely used and influential benchmark dataset for indoor 3D scene understanding.  Its comprehensive annotations and large scale make it a crucial resource for evaluating and comparing 3D semantic segmentation models.  The paper's impact is evident in its frequent citation across various 3D vision research papers, including the current work.

references.paper_title: Point-wise Convolutional Neural Network
references.reason: This paper introduced a novel point-wise convolutional neural network architecture for processing point cloud data.  Point-based methods are a significant category of 3D semantic segmentation models, and this paper's contribution is relevant to the development and understanding of such architectures. Its influence on subsequent point cloud processing research is substantial.

references.paper_title: PointNet: Deep Learning on Point Sets for 3D Classification and Segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduced PointNet, a pioneering work in applying deep learning directly to point cloud data for 3D classification and segmentation. PointNet's architecture and approach have significantly influenced the development of many subsequent point-based deep learning methods for 3D vision tasks, including semantic segmentation, and its impact remains significant.

references.paper_title: PointNet++: Deep Hierarchical Feature Learning on Point Sets in a Metric Space
references.reason: This paper proposed PointNet++, an extension of PointNet that addresses the limitations of PointNet in handling large-scale point clouds. PointNet++ introduced a hierarchical approach to feature learning, which has been widely adopted and adapted in various 3D deep learning architectures, showcasing its considerable influence in 3D vision.

references.paper_title: 4D Spatio-Temporal ConvNets: Minkowski Convolutional Neural Networks
references.reason: This paper introduced MinkowskiNet, a widely used and highly influential architecture for 3D semantic segmentation. Its unique approach to handling irregular point cloud data through the Minkowski convolutional structure has led to significant advancements in the field. Its influence is evident in its widespread adoption and adaptation in many subsequent research works.

references.paper_title: 4D Spatio-Temporal ConvNets: Minkowski Convolutional Neural Networks
references.reason: This paper introduced MinkowskiNet, a widely used and highly influential architecture for 3D semantic segmentation. Its unique approach to handling irregular point cloud data through the Minkowski convolutional structure has led to significant advancements in the field. Its influence is evident in its widespread adoption and adaptation in many subsequent research works.

references.paper_title: Point transformer v2: Grouped vector attention and partition-based pooling
references.reason: This paper introduced Point Transformer V2, a significant improvement over the original Point Transformer architecture.  The efficiency and scalability improvements are important advancements in the field, as transformer-based models are increasingly used for 3D semantic segmentation tasks.

references.paper_title: Point transformer v3: Simpler, faster, stronger
references.reason: This paper introduced Point Transformer V3, building upon the previous Point Transformer versions. The enhanced efficiency and scalability make it a highly relevant architecture for handling large-scale 3D datasets for semantic segmentation.  The paper's impact is notable for its state-of-the-art performance on benchmark datasets.

references.paper_title: Point transformer v3: Simpler, faster, stronger
references.reason: This paper introduced Point Transformer V3, building upon the previous Point Transformer versions. The enhanced efficiency and scalability make it a highly relevant architecture for handling large-scale 3D datasets for semantic segmentation.  The paper's impact is notable for its state-of-the-art performance on benchmark datasets.

references.paper_title: Segment Anything
references.reason: This paper introduced the Segment Anything Model (SAM), a highly influential and widely used model for image segmentation.  Its ability to generalize well to various scenarios makes it a valuable tool for numerous computer vision tasks. This work has a broad impact on computer vision in general, but its impact on this project is its application to improving LabelMakerV2, improving the quality and quantity of the labels automatically generated.

references.paper_title: Grounding dino: Marrying dino with grounded pre-training for open-set object detection
references.reason: This paper introduced Grounding DINO, a powerful model for grounding semantic labels and natural language to object instances in images, improving both the precision and recall compared with other similar methods. Grounding DINO improves the robustness of the LabelMakerV2 pipeline by leveraging its ability to locate and segment instances.

references.paper_title: Arkitscenes: A diverse real-world dataset for 3d indoor scene understanding using mobile rgb-d data
references.reason: This paper introduced ARKitScenes, a large-scale collection of RGB-D trajectories captured with consumer tablets.  While having sparse object bounding boxes, it provided a foundation for the ARKit LabelMaker project, which extended it with dense semantic annotations for pre-training 3D semantic segmentation models.

references.paper_title: Arkitscenes: A diverse real-world dataset for 3d indoor scene understanding using mobile rgb-d data
references.reason: This paper introduced ARKitScenes, a large-scale collection of RGB-D trajectories captured with consumer tablets.  While having sparse object bounding boxes, it provided a foundation for the ARKit LabelMaker project, which extended it with dense semantic annotations for pre-training 3D semantic segmentation models.

references.paper_title: Mix3D: Out-of-Context Data Augmentation for 3D Scenes
references.reason: This paper introduced Mix3D, a data augmentation technique for 3D scenes. Data augmentation is a common technique used to improve the performance of deep learning models and thus this method is used as a comparative method in this work. It explores how out-of-context data augmentation can benefit 3D semantic segmentation tasks.

references.paper_title: Mix3D: Out-of-Context Data Augmentation for 3D Scenes
references.reason: This paper introduced Mix3D, a data augmentation technique for 3D scenes. Data augmentation is a common technique used to improve the performance of deep learning models and thus this method is used as a comparative method in this work. It explores how out-of-context data augmentation can benefit 3D semantic segmentation tasks.

references.paper_title: Self-supervised pre-training with masked shape prediction for 3d scene understanding
references.reason: This paper explores self-supervised pre-training for 3D scene understanding using masked shape prediction. Self-supervised learning is a valuable area of research that aims to reduce the reliance on large manually labeled datasets, making it an important area of study to be considered in relation to this work.

references.paper_title: Language-Grounded Indoor 3D Semantic Segmentation in the Wild
references.reason: This paper introduced ScanNet200, an extension of the ScanNet dataset with a larger number of semantic classes (200). ScanNet200 is used as one of the benchmarks in this paper, highlighting its significance for evaluating 3D semantic segmentation models.

references.paper_title: Language-Grounded Indoor 3D Semantic Segmentation in the Wild
references.reason: This paper introduced ScanNet200, an extension of the ScanNet dataset with a larger number of semantic classes (200). ScanNet200 is used as one of the benchmarks in this paper, highlighting its significance for evaluating 3D semantic segmentation models.

references.paper_title: LabelMaker: Automatic Semantic Label Generation from RGB-D Trajectories
references.reason: This paper introduced LabelMaker, an automatic semantic annotation pipeline, which forms the foundation for the ARKit LabelMaker project.  LabelMaker's ability to automatically generate semantic labels is crucial to the creation of the large-scale dataset presented in this paper. Its extension and enhancement are key to this work.
